fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
[G Suite|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/set-up-g-suite/] only allows you to specify the users you want to sync in the paid version. However, currently when you're using a free version and you want to stop syncing everyone from Google, even when you pay for [Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access], there is no option to remove users from the sync without disabling their accounts. 

h3. Workaround
# Remove the integration
# Subscribe to [Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access]
# Reconfigure the integration and sync only the desired accounts and groups

h3. Suggested Solutions
Improve the integration making it possible for the admins to remove synced accounts without deactivating them. For example: import a CSV file, for example, with the account to be removed from the external directory (accounts they don't want in the sync anymore).
fields.summary: Improve the transition from G Suite free to Paid

fields.description:
When the following conditions are met, a group conflict will trigger.
 * The provisioned group name matches an existing group with the same name on the target Atlassian site.
 * The existing group contains a different set of members compared to the members in the provisioned group. 

When a conflict occurs, the admins need to resolve them manually via the org administration (see [document)|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/resolve-group-conflicts-when-syncing-users/]

*Suggestion* : Allow an option to automatically override the groups in the Atlassian site with the provisioned group if there is a difference in group membership.
fields.summary: Ability to resolve duplicate groups conflicts from IdP automatically

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a [Authentication policies|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/authentication-policies-1018779823.html] CSV import fails the error is triggered but other than that, no additional information about the accounts causing that issue(s) is displayed. 

It might be a problem for long CSV files, demanding from the customer a lot of effort to troubleshoot the problem, probably enforcing them to create a support ticket for more details.  

h3. Suggested Solutions
Alongside the error message, provide a list of accounts causing the issues when trying to import users to an authentication policy. For example: 

- *Unmanaged accounts in the CSV:* when there are unmanaged accounts in the list,  let the admins know which are those accounts (providing a text/CSV file for download) so they can remove them from the CSV file.
fields.summary: Provide more details about why an Authentication Policy CSV import failed and the accounts that caused it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Last Active" value in a managed account profile page is shown as unavailable if the user does not have any product access. It does not return any value in the API response as well for the "Get User API" query.

Also noted that in certain cases, even if the user has product access and has recently logged in to Atlassian system, the "Last Active" tag is shown as "unavailable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit a managed account profile without product access.
 # Check the value in "Last Active".
 # Also run an API query for Get User API and notice the absence of "Last Active" tag for this user.

h3. Expected Results

The "Last Active" tag should be consistent and correct for all the managed accounts.
h3. Actual Results

The "Last Active" value in a managed account profile page is shown as unavailable if the user does not have any product access.Also noted that in certain cases, even if the user has product access and has recently logged in to Atlassian system, the "Last Active" tag is shown as "unavailable.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The "Last Active" value in a managed account profile page is shown as unavailable if the user does not have any product access.

fields.description: Provide the ability to anonymize an accounts' personally identifiable information (PII) directly from the IDP if, for example, the account is anonymized or deleted in the IDP.
fields.summary: Ability to anonymize a user's data directly from the IDP

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* The UI doesn't show any steps or tips on how to create a CSV that works with the "Bulk entry" feature in authentication policies
* The error message shown is generic

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add some text in the UI or link to documentation to instruct customers on how to best format CSVs for bulk entry
* More descriptive error message showing what the error is and at which line the error occurs

h3. Why this is important
* The feature is not very forgiving with various CSV formats, formatting and encoding, e.g. ACCESS-1063
* Successful validation/passing can be quite frustrating as it requires some trial and error - especially when the error message is not descriptive
* Many customers prefer Excel for CSV editing/creation - CSVs generated by Excel has many potential quirks which may cause issues with the bulk entry feature due to the many formatting options/features offered in Excel
 
h3. Workaround
* Use a text editor to visually validate the CSV and ensure that there aren't any unexpected characters or spacing.  Expected formatting:
{noformat}
email1@domain.com,email2@domain.com,email3@domain.com,email4@domain.com,email5@domain.com
{noformat} *OR*
{noformat}
email1@domain.com,
email2@domain.com,
email3@domain.com,
email4@domain.com,
email5@domain.com
{noformat}
* Applications or OSs may unexpectedly add random characters to the CSV
fields.summary: Authentication policies: Add bulk entry option CSV formatting instructions and more descriptive error messages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
According to the [Authentication Policies documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/edit-authentication-settings-and-members/], when adding new users to a policy, org admins should be able to add any managed account to an authentication policy. However, deactivated users are never shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Make sure you have an Atlassian organization with an [Atlassian Access subscription|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access] and a [verified/claimed domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html].
 # Access the organization administration.
 # Click on *Security*, on the top navigation bar.
 # Click on *Authentication Policies*, on the sidebar.
 # Edit a policy (create a new one if needed).
 # Navigate to the Members tab.
 # Click on *Add members* button.
 # Search for the deactivated user.

h3. Expected Results
Deactivated users should show up in the search to add members to an authentication policy.

h3. Actual Results
Deactivated users do not show up.

h3. Workaround

Deactivated users can have their authentication policy changed by:
# Going to the authentication policy the user was last in and click "Change member's policy" next to the user's name.
# [Using the bulk upload option|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/edit-authentication-settings-and-members/#Editauthenticationsettingsandmembers-Addmemberstoyourauthenticationpolicies].
fields.summary: The user search to add members to an authentication policy is not finding deactivated users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an organization has more than 10k managed user accounts it would display more than 500 pages in total. Navigating to page number 500 and above does not work. 
As we display 20 users per page it looks like we are not able to fetch users with an index above 10000. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Managed accounts at the organization with more than 10k managed accounts 
 # Navigate to page number 500 and above.
 # Example: [https://admin.atlassian.com/o/\|https://admin.atlassian.com/o/]{ORGID}/members?page=505

h3. Expected Results

The page should load and show up the managed accounts details.
h3. Actual Results

Page gets stuck and does not load
h3. Workaround

Use the *Export accounts* option under *Managed accounts --> Export accounts*.
This provides the option to export a CSV file containing all your managed accounts which may be useful in certain cases.
fields.summary: Unable to navigate beyond page 500 and above for managed accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an organization has more than 10k managed user accounts it would display more than 500 pages in total. Navigating to page number 500 and above does not work. 
As we display 20 users per page it looks like we are not able to fetch users with an index above 10000. 
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
 # Open Managed accounts at the organization with more than 10k managed accounts 
 # Navigate to page number 500 and above.
 # Example: https://admin.atlassian.com/o/\{ORGID}/members?page=505

h3. Actual Result:

Page gets stuck and does not load
h3. Expected Result:

The page should load and show up the managed accounts details.
h3. Workaround:

Use the *Export accounts* option under *Managed accounts --> Export accounts*.
This provides the option to export a CSV file containing all your managed accounts which may be useful in certain cases.
fields.summary: Unable to navigate beyond page 500 and above for managed accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Retrieving User Provisioning Synced users and Synced groups will intermittently fail with the messages: "*Something went wrong. Try again later*" or "*No information found.*"
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Access the User provisioning page at *admin.atlassian.com* > *Directory* > *User provisioning*
{code:java}
https://admin.atlassian.com/o/{OrgId}/user-provisioning
{code}
h3. Expected Results

Synced users and groups to be loaded with all synced users/groups from IdP.
h3. Actual Results

The below errors is thrown in the screen:

!image-2021-06-24-09-52-53-530.png|width=292,height=243!

or

!image-2021-06-24-09-55-39-955.png|width=303,height=164!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Intermittent errors to retrieve Atlassian Access User Provisioning Synced Users and groups

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

GSuite free version currently syncs all the GSuite users to a single directory. This results in syncing of the google accounts which are not Atlassian related.
This also prevents the organisation administrators from setting up auto-provisioning of product access.

h3. Suggestion

GSuite free version should auto-provision users from within a single GSuite group. That will allow Gsuite admins to sync only users that they choose to - not the entire directory.
fields.summary: GSuite free version should auto-provision users from within a single GSuite group.

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

Atlassian presented the feature [Discovered products  |https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/discover-products-your-users-administer/] which gives the ability for Org admins to see if their managed users created products outside their Organization.

Currently the feature also sends notifications for Org admins when a managed user creates a product outside their Org, but not when they join a different product.

h3. Suggestion

Add the ability to receive notifications when a managed user joins a product/site outside of the Org.
fields.summary: Notify Org admins when a managed user joins a product outside their Organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

Atlassian presented the feature [Discovered products  |https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/discover-products-your-users-administer/] which gives the ability for Org admins to see if their managed users created products outside their Organization.

Currently the feature does not show information related to Bitbucket or Trello though.

h3. Suggestion

Add support for Bitbucket and Trello.
fields.summary: Support Bitbucket and Trello on the Discovered Products section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleted sandboxes are showing up in discovered products

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Managed user creates a sandbox at a site outside the organization.
 # Delete this sandbox
 # Check the "Discovered Products" page

h3. Expected Results
The deleted sandbox is not showing up

h3. Actual Results
The deleted sandbox is showing up

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleted sandboxes are showing up in discovered products

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing the "Discovered Products" page in Atlassian Access, you will see that the user count of the product displayed in Discovered Products is incorrect.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a user that has created a Confluence/Jira site that is a managed user
 # Grant product access to some users at the above sites
 # Check the "Discovered Products" page


h3. Expected Results
The value of "user count" is equal to the number of users who have access granted in Step 2.

h3. Actual Results
The value of "user count" is not equal to the number of users who have access granted in Step 2.
 !AtlassianSupport 2021-06-03 15.55.49.png|thumbnail!  !AtlassianSupport 2021-06-03 15.55.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The user count of the product displayed in Discovered Products is incorrect.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira and Confluence are connected so the [Jira issues macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-jira-issues-macro/] can be used to retrieve issues from Jira in Confluence, if [IP allowlisting is enabled|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/] on Jira, anonymous users will not be able to view the information on the Jira issues macro.

Instead, the following message is displayed:

!anonymous_issue.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(i) Make sure to have the Premium version of Jira so IP allowlisting can be configured for it.
 # Create a few issues in Jira and have the project of these issues with [public access enabled|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/allow-anonymous-access-to-projects/]
 # Have [Confluence Cloud open for public access|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/] and ensure that a single space is open for the public as well.
 # In that space, add the Jira issues macro to retrieve issues from the created Jira project. Select the *Table view* mode after ensuring that more than one issue is retrieved.
 # Now, configure IP allowlisting for Jira (feel free to also do it for Confluence as well, but, this will not impact the results).
 # Access the Confluence page with the Jira issues macro as an anonymous user (not logged in to an Atlassian account)

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to view the issues on the Confluence page. If the Jira project was not open for anonymous, the table would be empty.

(i) If only a single issue is retrieved, it should retrieve the issue as well.
h3. Actual Results

The following message is displayed for the Table view:
{quote}Unable to locate JIRA server for this macro. It may be due to Application Link configuration.
{quote}
 

(i) For the single issue view, it will display only the link to the issue and not the smart card for the Jira issue macro.
h3. Workaround

As an anonymous user, tap the *View these issues in Jira* button in the Jira issues macro.
fields.summary: Enabling IP allowlisting on Jira blocks anonymous users to view the Jira issues macro in Confluence

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
* We've rolled out nonbillable policy for Authentication Policies, and for now, we cannot set it to be the default authentication policy.

h4. Current behavior.
* A default policy is always billable. If you don't want to pay for certain members, make another policy nonbillable and add them to it.

h4. Suggested behavior
* Allow the default policy to be set as nonbillable.
* This would be great for Org admins who only want Statuspage users to be using SSO, while the rest of their user base is excluded.
fields.summary: Allow Nonbillable policy to be set as the default policy

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[Org Audit Logs|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/track-organization-activities-from-the-audit-log/] are available when you subscribe to [Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access]. The logs will contain information from Instances that are linked to the Org, and also for actions performed on the Org level. However, the hyperlink to the account on the Org logs is not working properly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform an action on the Org that generates an audit log (such as deactivating a managed account, changing the membership of a policy, etc).
 # Access the Org Audit Logs. 
 # Click on the hyperlink for the account on the log it was created.

h3. Expected Results

The managed account should load.
h3. Actual Results

Below error is displayed:

!image-2021-06-08-18-52-52-249.png!
h3. Workaround

This issue happens because the link is incorrect. The link used is according to below structure:
{code:java}
 https://admin.atlassian.com/o/<OrgID>/users/<AAID>{code}
Replace {{users}} by {{members}} on the link, and you'll be redirected to the user profile:
{code:java}
https://admin.atlassian.com/o/<OrgID>/members/<AAID>{code}
fields.summary: Links to managed accounts on the Org Audit Logs are not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It's currently not possible to define permission scope for API tokens created on Atlassian organizations for the purposes of calling these published APIs:
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/intro/#auth]
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/intro/#auth]

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow admins to define or make the API key "read-only" enabled

h3. Why this is important
 * Offers more flexibility in terms of security

h3. Workaround
 * No known workarounds
fields.summary: REST API: Allow permissions scope to be defined for a REST API token

fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario

Currently, changing a user role is not logged on the Org Audit Logs (even though the user is added to the site-admins group, such information is not logged in the logs). 
h3. Proposed Solution

Improve the Org Audit Logs so that it also records changes on roles.
fields.summary: Changing a user role on the Instance administration doesn't generate a log on the Org Audit Logs

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

On the Discovered products, it shows Cloud sites created by users from a verified domain, but it doesn't show if the site is active or deactivated.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add a new column showing the status of the sites (Active/Deactivated/Deleted).

This will inform the Admins as to the state of the product and whether or not additional action needs to be taken.
fields.summary: Show the status of the sites on Discovered products

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When attempting to bulk Add Members to an Authentication policy via CSV it will fail if the file contains the CRLF End of Line character encoding set.
h3. Steps to replicate

1 - Export users from [https://admin.atlassian.com/o/org_id/members]
 2 - Modify the exported CSV file to include only the emails of the users you wish to add to that policy
 3 - Navigate to the Auth policy you want to bulk add members and click edit. 
 4 - Click Members tab > Add members > Bulk Entry
 5 - Upload the CSV from step 2
 !image-2021-06-04-13-49-55-264.png|width=289,height=242!
h3. Expected results

Policy will be updated with the email address in the CSV file
h3. Actual results

Policy isn't updated with the emails addresses in the CSV file. A popup is shown:
{quote}Unable to find members

We're unable to find any of these members. Make
 sure all your members are managed accounts and try
 again.
{quote}
h3. Workaround
 - Using a text editor change the End of Line encoding to LF instead of CRLF
- Ensure that the encoding is UTF-8
fields.summary: Authentication Policy Bulk Add Members fails to import emails via CSV

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Organization Admins that are manually deactivating and activating Managed Accounts in their Organization would like to disable the Notifications that are sent to their End Users
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Update the text in the Account Deactivate/Activated Email to indicate the User's Atlassian account used to access Atlassian Cloud Services has been (de)activated.
 * Add an option that disables the notification from being sent

h3. Why this is important

Some environments have both Atlassian Cloud and OnPrem/Datacenter Products and this notification may confuse some of their End Users as to what "account" is being Deactivated/Reactivated

h3. Workaround

Subscribe to Atlassian Access and configure User Provisioning
 * Managed Accounts in sync with an Identity Provider via User Provisioning are not sent the deactivation/activation notifications
fields.summary: Update the Text or Add Options to Disable Managed Account (De)Activation Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing the "Discovered Products" page in Atlassian Access, you will see sites that have been deleted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1, Have a user that has created a Confluence/Jira site that is a managed user
 # Step 2, have the site deleted
 # Step 3, Check the "Discovered Products" page

h3. Expected Results
Deleted site will no longer show up in the list of discovered products
*or*
The site shows up as having been deleted

h3. Actual Results
Site shows as if it were an Active site.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing Discovered Products shows deleted sites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unverified accounts don't return in the search field to add a new member to an [Authentication policies|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/authentication-policies-1018779823.html]. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the Org > Security > Authentication Policies > Edit > members tab > Add members
# At the Individual entry, search for the unverified account

h3. Expected Results
The account should return in the search to be added to the policy.

h3. Actual Results
The user does not return. 

h3. Workaround
Add the account(s) to the policies using the *Bulk entry* option (CSV file).
fields.summary: Unverified accounts don't appear in the Authentication Police > Add members > Individual Entry search field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customers that have moved Managed User Accounts to different Authentication Policies within their Organization have noticed a significant delay with the UI updating to show the membership change, however, the Organization Audit Log shows that the User has been moved to the New Policy, Notification is sent to the Org Admin about the Policy Change, and the User has the Policy Features applied. Customer admin might see an invalid policy due to the delayed display. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

In an Organization with an Atlassian Access Subscription, Verified Domain(s), and multiple Authentication Policies
 # Move a User to another Authentication Policy

h3. Expected Results
 * The Member count of the Secondary Policy increases and the User is shown as a Member of the New/Secondary Policy
 * The User is no longer seen as a member of the Old Policy and the Member count decreases

h3. Actual Results

In the UI, the User is still shown to be a member of the Old Policy, however, in the backend it appears that the New/Secondary Policy is being applied to them
 * Organization Admins see the change has been made in the Organization Audit Log and the New Policy is applied to the User when they login

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Authentication Policy Membership Updates Are Not Reflected in the UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With [Authentication policies|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/authentication-policies-1018779823.html] SAML will only be enforced when applied to at least one policy. The Org admins must enforce that either by changing or creating an authentication policy then accessing it and clicking on *Enforce sign-on*. 

We have a notification that helps a bit when SAML is not enforced in any Policy:
{quote}
(!) *SAML single sign-on isn’t enforced for any policies*
Go to policy settings, to enforce SAML single sign-on.
View authentication policies
{quote}
!image.png|thumbnail!

However, we receive support tickets where the admins don't understand why SAML is not being applied. It might indicate that the info banner could be improved.

h3. Suggested Solutions
If SAML is not applied to any policy, open a pop-up when admins save the SAML configuration with that banner message.
fields.summary: Enhance the experience after configuring SAML with Authentication Policies

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In several organizations, the domain verification is failing:

 !Screen Shot 2021-05-21 at 16.24.28.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try domain verification

h3. Expected Results

The domain verification works.

h3. Actual Results

When I tried reproduction, the domain verification fails due to HTTP 409 Conflict:

https://admin.atlassian.com/gateway/api/adminhub/organization/b56474df-9ae0-4816-a7ee-7711a4b489c5/domainClaims/bukkentime.com/verify/dnsAsync

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Domain verification is failing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have an Organization with [verified domain(s)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html] and an [Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access] subscription, you can apply different security policies on sub set of users using [Authentication Policies|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/understand-authentication-policies/]. However, if you add a user to a different policy, even though the change is reflecting on the back-end, the policy membership is not updated on the UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have a verified domain, an Atlassian Access subscription and at least two Authentication Policies on your Organization.
 # Move a user from one policy to another.

h3. Expected Results

After a few seconds, such change should reflect on the UI (on the Policy membership).
h3. Actual Results

Even though there's an app notification confirming the change, the email confirmation is sent and the change is also listed on the Org Audit Logs, the Policy membership won't reflect.

(on) Note that the change is fulfilled in the back-end - this issue affects only the policy membership showed on the UI.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changes applied to the Authentication Policies membership are not reflecting on the UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Mobile sessions continue to receive notifications after implementing IP allowlist

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to to a Jira mobile application and connect via mobile network. 
 # Implement IP allow listing to restrict access base on IP address
 # Try to assign a Jira issue to the mobile user

h3. Expected Results

Mobile sessions should have been invalidated after the allow list implementation and there should be no notification to the user. 

h3. Actual Results

User with mobile session continue to receive notifications. 

h3. Workaround

Perform a global password reset to log out users.
fields.summary: Mobile sessions continue to receive notifications after implementing IP allowlist

fields.description:
At the moment the SSO in Atlassian Cloud is implemented on the organization level and it is enforced to managed account on all products that uses Atlassian Accounts. As such, end users will always need to enter an email address in id.atlassian.com to be able to initiate a SAML-SSO authentication

*Suggestion* :

Provide an SSO solution on the site level
 * Allow SSO deep links
 * Bypass Atlassian login page
 * SSO can also be enforced to external users in the site.
fields.summary: SSO on the Atlassian cloud site level

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The need to see how long a specific user stay logged in for and how often. Also, a history of logins for specific users in a period of time. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a session in User Management that shows different statistics to monitor users, source IP address, logged time, last session and active session.
fields.summary: Monitor user login activity

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers with multiple Authentication Policies may need to check to see who is a member of a policy 

h3. Suggested Solution
- Show what Policy a User is a Member of when viewing their Managed Account Details
- Include an option to Export Members from an Authentication Policy 
- Include Authentication Policy details as part of the Organization Managed Accounts Export 

h3. Why this is important
Customers may need to audit and confirm what Policy a User belongs to
fields.summary: Need some way audit and confirm what Policy a User belongs to

fields.description:
At the moment IP allow list can be used to restrict access to the cloud site. 

It would provide additional security if the allow list can also be applied on the organization admin pages.
fields.summary: IP allowlist on organization administration

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Product Team Update -  19/October/2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#143ae0|titleColor=#ffffff}
For new customers - we have increased the user provisioning sync limit to 70k users.

For existing customers - we have increased the user provisioning sync limit to 70k users. However, as part of our efforts to scale SCIM without affecting performance, a group limit of 20k members needs to be introduced. In your current configuration, SCIM creates a default group (All members for directory) which contains all your synced users.

If you need to provision more than 20k users in total, we would need to delete the default group that’s automatically created. If this workaround is feasible to you, please reach out to Support so we can assess the change.

There are also a small number of customers that we have not migrated to the 70k user provisioning sync limit due to being close to or above the 20k group size limit. Please reach out to Support for assistance.

Cheers, 
Matt H
Product Management team.
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Product Team Update -  03/July/2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#143ae0|titleColor=#ffffff}
Hi,

This is Matt from the Identity team. 

The SCIM limit has now been increased to 20k for Atlassian products (including JSM). 

Cheers, 
Matt H
Product Management team.
{panel}  
{panel:title=Atlassian Product Team Update -  27/May/2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#143ae0|titleColor=#ffffff}
Hi,

This is Matt from the Identity team. 

We will be increasing the SCIM limit to 70k users by 30 September 2021.

Cheers, 
Matt H
Product Management team.
{panel}  

h4. Current Scenario

Currently, Atlassian allows you to create a [User Provisioning (SCIM) integration|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/understand-user-provisioning/] capable of syncing up to 10k users.

This limit might not be enough for specific needs from some users that are scaling our products. More specifically, since we don't have a [customer limit for JSM|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-management/pricing], companies expect to be able to provision their users to the site, so they could access the JSM portal using an Atlassian account. Such functionality allow them to:
 * Provision and de-provisiong these users' accounts through the SCIM integration.
 * Enable SSO for these users (in case they are from a verified domain).

h4. Suggested Solution

Add capability of syncing more than 10k users for accounts that will be just accessing the JSM Portal (not licensed on the products).
fields.summary: Increase the limit of synced users on the User Provisioning (SCIM) integration for JSM customer only accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deleted accounts are still showing on the Managed Accounts section
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your Org administration.
 # Navigate to Directory.

h3. Expected Results

Accounts that were already deleted shouldn't appear on the list.
h3. Actual Results

Deleted accounts are showing with the *FOR DELETION* status badge.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleted accounts are still showing on the Managed Accounts section

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As an administrator of an [Atlassian organization|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/what-is-an-atlassian-organization/], the user is able to [export the audit logs|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/track-organization-activities-from-the-audit-log/].

Even that the export can filter data, the entries added in the CSV file will be limited to 10,000, which depending on the size of the organization, can provide entries for a small number of days.

h3.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to allow the number of entries to be more than 10,000. Alternatively, provide the admin with an option to configure the number of entries.
fields.summary: Increase the limit of entries for the organization's Audit log export

fields.description:
At this moment, we do not have admin API endpoints to manage Atlassian Organization authentication policies.

It will be desired to have API endpoints covering these points:

- Adding and removing users to a specific authentication policy.
- Change configurations for authentication policy.
fields.summary: Manage Authentication Policies via admin API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have an [Atlassian Access subscription|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access], you are able to enforce authentication with SAML Single sign-on through Google, after creating a [G Suite integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/connect-to-g-suite-873918510.html].

However, if you disconnect the integration, and then [verify the domains locally|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html] (either through DNS or HTTPS), the users will still be enforced to authenticate with SSO.

(on) This bug only affects Organisations in which [Authentication Policies|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/understand-authentication-policies/] is enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a G Suite integration on an Org with Atlassian Access.
 # Enforce authentication with Single sign-on on the policy.
 # Disconnect the G Suite integration.
 # Verify the domains directly on the Org.
 # Try to authenticate with one of the users.

h3. Expected Results

You should be authenticating locally, as the Org doesn't have any SAML SSO configuration in place anymore.
h3. Actual Results

Members of this policy are still enforced to authenticate with Google.
h3. Workaround

If you are implementing a new SSO integration, after creating it, you will be able to edit the policy that was enforcing SSO with Google, so you can simply perform a dummy update (Edit -> Save). This would redirect the users to the new IDP.

If you are not planning to implement any other SSO integration, you won't be able to update the existing policy which is causing the issue. The only workaround at the moment would be to create a new policy not enforcing SSO, and move the users to this new policy.
fields.summary: Single Sign on is still enforced after disconnecting the G Suite integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to the [Authentication Policies documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/edit-authentication-settings-and-members/], when adding new users to a policy, Org admins should be able to search by the user's email address, or by the user's name. However, the search for email address is not working properly. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(on) Make sure you have an Organisation with an [Atlassian Access subscription|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access] and a [verified/claimed domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html].
 # Access the Org administration.
 # Click on *Security*, on the top navigation bar.
 # Click on *Authentication Policies*, on the sidebar.
 # Edit a policy (create a new one if needed).
 # Navigate to the Members tab.
 # Click on *Add members* button.
 # Paste the exact email from the user.

h3. Expected Results

The search should return only the specific user. 
h3. Actual Results

The search return users that aren't matching the input field. Besides, if you delete the last letter from the email (let's say the *m* from *.com*), the search won't return any user.
h3. Workaround

You should be able to find the user searching for their name, instead of their email address. Make sure to search for the entire name (for example, searching for *Vi* won't return a user named *Vitor* - you would need to search for *Vitor*).
fields.summary: The user search to add members to an authentication policy is not working properly when searching for email addresses

fields.description:
Currently the authentication policies do not support automatic assignment which requires manual action to assign users to policies when they are created.

Suggestion: Make SCIM synced groups be able to assign authentication policies.

The use case I can share for this is:
We want only a group of people to be enforced SSO so we make the default authentication policy to be one that is not enforced with SSO but now the need to manually add users to that group of people that should have enforced SSO arises.
fields.summary: Automatic assignment of authentication policies

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * An admin may want to only configure [IP allow lists|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access] for specific pages, Spaces or projects within Jira/Confluence and not necessarily the entire site.

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow admins to specify URL paths that the polices applies to

h3. Why this is important
 * More flexibility as some project/Space admins may want IP allow listing, but others may not

h3. Workaround

(Optional)
fields.summary: IP allow list: Allow specific policies to only apply to specific pages/Spaces/Projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Admins may want an [IP allow list|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access] policy to apply to a subset of users, i.e. a set of users can't log in unless they are on a specific network, but other users don't have that restriction

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow admins to apply IP allow list policies to a subset of users

h3. Why this is important
* More flexibility
 
h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Allow admins to define an IP allow list within an authentication policy

fields.description:
At the present moment, User Provisioning troubleshooting log has
- Limited information that does not help troubleshooting integration errors
-- Example: _Resource [USER]: with email[someuser@somedomain.com] already exists._
--- What is the account trying to assign that already taken email address?
--- What is the account currently using that already taken email address?
- No navigation helpers such as a search bar or a date filter.
-- The logs are being rolled and you have no way to filter out the irrelevant information.
- Logs get cleared out after 30 days.
- No option to log sync calls that are successful.
fields.summary: Improve User Provisioning Troubleshooting log

fields.description:
h2.Problem
Currently, you can only add members into authentication policies one by one or in bulk using a CSV file.

h2.Suggestion
Allow org admins to be able to add groups to the authentication policies, especially, groups being synced by user provisioning.
fields.summary: Allow org admins to be able to add groups to the authentication policies, especially, groups being synced by user provisioning

fields.description:
h4. Current Scenario

When the Atlassian Access subscription is facing issues to be renewed, Billing Contacts are emailed to review their payment details, so the subscription isn't lost. However, email notifications are easily lost, or even categorised as spam. Once the subscription is removed, both the SAML and SCIM integration will stop working.
h4. Suggested Improvement

Implement in-app notifications/banners for Org admins so they are aware that there's an issue with the Access subscription, allowing them to review it before the subscription is suspended.
fields.summary: Implement in app notifications/banners in case the Atlassian Access subscription wasn't successfully renewed

fields.description:
Currently, when Org Admins create an Auth Policy, they need to add the Members to the policy individually.

This creates a lot of hassle for Orgs that have members joining everyday and the Org has multiple domains claimed. The Auth Policy however only needs to be applied to One Domain.

*Suggestion:*

It would be nice to add an option to add the domain to the Auth Policy, i.e. people from that particular domain will be automatically added to this Auth Policy while others will be redirected to the default/ other Auth policy.
fields.summary: Allow a domain to be added to Authentication policy

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When calling GET /admin/v1/orgs/ \{orgId}/users ([Get users in organization|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-orgs/#api-orgs-orgid-users-get]) REST API endpoint, the results set doesn't include unverified accounts

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send a GET request to /admin/v1/orgs/\{orgId}/users

h3. Expected Results
 * The returned list of Atlassian accounts should include unverified Atlassian accounts as the accounts are now being surfaced in the "Managed accounts" page in the Atlassian organization admin UI
 * As per [ACCESS-617|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-617], unverified Atlassian accounts are now listed on the "Managed accounts" page in the Atlassian organization admin UI

h3. Actual Results
 * The returned list of Atlassian accounts doesn't include unverified Atlassian accounts

h3. Workaround
 * No known workarounds if unverified Atlassian accounts need to be fetched programatically
 * It's possible to get a list of unverified Atlassian accounts by using the CSV export functionality on the "Managed accounts" page in the Atlassian organization admin UI
fields.summary: Calling REST API endpoint fetch all managed Atlassian accounts doesn't include unverified Atlassian accounts

fields.description:
Sometimes when org admins are dealing with multiple accounts for the same person (maybe due to a typo, a name change or a SCIM misconfiguration), it is useful to know which account is the oldest, as that is the one they are most likely to keep (it has the most historical data)

Please consider exposing the Atlassian account creation date for the org admins in the account's page
fields.summary: Expose account creation date for org admins

fields.description:
Org Admins cannot control the addition of SSO managed users into sites not under their organisation. For example:
* Site A is under Org A - users in Org A are SSO managed
* Site B is under Org B
* A site admin in Site B may invite a user who is SSO managed by Org A.

For organisation security and compliance reasons, some organisations may require the ability to control or prevent the addition of such users to external sites.
fields.summary: Ability to control/prevent the addition of your SSO managed users into sites (not under your organisation)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the SAML SSO/User Provisioning settings relay in the NameID being the user email address to match the information between the identity platform and the Atlassian Account.

h3. Suggestion
It would be nice to have an option to customize this attribute to rely on different information than the email address, like the user name, or user ID. 
For a first-time configuration, the email should match, as this way it the accounts would be correctly mapped, but for new users and after setting it up once, it would be nice to have this level of customization.
fields.summary: Allow customization of the Name ID attribute

fields.description:
Hello.

Is it possible to add the possibility to filter by "no product access" on Managed Accounts listing? Right now we can filter by any product, but if I want to see only the "No Product access" accounts I don't have how to filter it.

!image-2021-03-26-10-45-03-897.png!

Kind regards.

Filipe
fields.summary: Filter by "no product access" on Managed Accounts listing
Documentation update: Gsync Atlassian account deactivation behavior

fields.description:
*Problem:*

Currently, when Org Admins verify a domain however do not Claim the Accounts, the SAML Settings page shows the following error/warning:

"Your organization does not have any verified domains. Complete the domain verification process to manage accounts in this organization."

However, in reality, the domain is actually verified but the Accounts are not claimed.

*Suggested Solution:*

The error should be somewhat like:

"Your organization does not have any Claimed Accounts. In order to complete the domain verification process, please click on Claim Accounts and start managing accounts in this organization."
fields.summary: Show a more meaningful message when domain are verified but Accounts are not claimed

fields.description:
Organization administrators are getting blocked from deleting certain managed accounts because these accounts have licenses tied to them, currently, this is demanding quite some effort from the administrator as they need to:
 # Re-gain access to the Atlassian account so they can transfer the subscriptions
 ** Sometimes they do not have an SSO to set that up easily
 ** The mail box in most cases will no longer exist to recover the account
 # As a last resort, they need to change the email to become an alias of their own accounts
 # Transfer the actual subscriptions or simply deactivate them - Which depending on the product, may take up to 15 days as a Cloud site (Jira or Confluence) has to be destroyed before unblocking the account for deletion.
 # Existing contacts have to manually log in to "my.atlassian.com" to remove users to be deleted.

Same problem can be encountered when discovering products that are owned by managed accounts owned by users who left the company. 


h1. Suggestion

- Allow org admins to remove managed accounts as contacts of the products via the org administration page.
- Allow org admins to transfer the ownership of the products owned by managed accounts.
fields.summary: Allow org admins to transfer ownership of products owned by managed accounts

fields.description:
h4. Current Scenario

It is currently possible to sync unmanaged accounts with SCIMS (accounts from domains that are not verified on the Organisation). This functionality helps customers to easily onboard teams, however, Org admins don't have an easy way to check which unmanaged accounts are being synced, on the Atlassian side. The only possible way would be to access the Instance, and export the users (containing group memberships), then filter by the directory groups, and check the email addresses for accounts that are not from the verified domains.
h4. Solution

Provide an easy way for Org admins to check which unmanaged accounts they are syncing. It could be a menu on the Org for *Unmanaged accounts*, in which admins wouldn't be able to manage them, but at least have visibility of them.
fields.summary: Improve visibility for synced unmanaged accounts (external accounts)

fields.description:
When [configuring SAML single sign-on|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/configure-saml-single-sign-on-with-an-identity-provider/], if the user uses URLs like https://id.atlassian.com, https://start.atlassian.com, and https://example.atlassian.net, this will allow people added to the identity provider to log-in via IDP-initiated log-in to Atlassian products and the account.

However, if the https://trello.com URL is used as the relay state, this will not authenticate the user to Trello and will require the account to use the *Log-in* flow, even though it is already authenticated to the Atlassian account.

h3.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to allow https://trello.com to be used as the *relay state*, automatically authenticating accounts, as it would happen with https://id.atlassian.com

h3.Workaround

Add the following URL to the *Relay state* configuration of the identity provider:

https://trello.com/appSwitcherLogin

This will automatically log the user to Trello.
fields.summary: Allow trello.com to be used as a relay state URL for IDP-initiated log-in

fields.description:
The user provisioning feature provided by Atlassian Access allows organizations to centralized their group membership management via a third party AD. 

- Provisioned groups can be configured for product access settings (license)
- Provisioned groups can be configured for application administration settings
- Provisioned groups can be configured for application permission settings

What is left to completely offload the group membership maintenance is the site-admin role. Organizations need to maintain a list of site-admin users locally on the cloud site instead of via a third party AD.

*Suggestion* : When user provisioning is enabled, allow the site-admin role to be assigned to  a custom provisioned group.
fields.summary: Allow the site-admin role to be assigned to a provisioned group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When reviewing and configuring product access for a Cloud site, it is not clear which group is created for Jira / Confluence manually and which is created as a result of sync with IDP.

We can see a "lock" sign in "Groups" section of user management:

!image-2021-03-16-15-39-05-983.png|width=939,height=261!

However we cannot see this in "Product Access" section:

!image-2021-03-16-15-40-21-444.png|width=800,height=264!
h3. Expected Results

It is easier to control product access when it is visible which group is synced with IDP.
fields.summary: Add description to IDP groups in "Product Access" section

fields.description:
h4. Current scenario
In case you have an [Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access] subscription, you can create a [SCIM integration|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/understand-user-provisioning/] to provision your users from your external Identity Provider. During the implementation phase, it's common to end up with duplicated accounts, as the mapping for SAML and SCIM can be different, and it's commonly needed to remove one account from the directory (on Atlassian side), to troubleshoot the duplication issue. 

Currently, the only way to perform this action is using the [Deactivate a user REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/api-group-users/#api-scim-directory-directoryid-users-userid-delete], which would delete the account from the directory, and deactivate it on Atlassian side. Then, Org admins are able to re-activate the account if needed. However, there isn't an easy way to perform this task on the UI, requiring admins to either rely on the API, or engage Atlassian Support to assist on the issue.

h4. Proposed Solution
Provide to Org admins the ability to remove accounts from the directory on the Organisation UI.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to remove synced accounts from the Directory through the UI

fields.description:
Site access is granted to internal users of an organization's to ensure that all security policies from Atlassian Access are enforced. At the moment though, admins can still grant site access to external users via the following channels. 

- Site admin manually invites the external accounts to the site
- Provisioning grants access to external accounts

The external accounts added to the site are then not enforced with the organization's Atlassian access security policies. 

*Suggestion* : On a site level, have a settings that prevent site access from being granted to external user.
fields.summary: Prevent external account access in cloud sites

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* 100 IP address/range/network block limit for IP allow lists
* Documentation: [Specify IP addresses for product access|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access]:
{quote}
You can set up 100 IP addresses or network blocks per allowlist.
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
* Increase the limit or allow customers to increase the limit

h3. Why this is important
* 100 addresses/ranges is not be enough for certain customers
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Increase IP allow list address/range/network block limit past 100

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The G Suite integration enables admins to let users decide how to log in: either with Google, or with their email + Atlassian password + (eventually) the Atlassian 2SV.

If users want to login with Atlassian, and have 2SV (2FA) enforced by the org admin, the admin can't exclude a single user from 2SV (so that the user is able to reset it)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Claimed domain, Atlassian Access, managed accounts
 # Enforce 2SV for everyone
# Connect G Suite, but allow users to chose how they want to log in.
# One user needs to reset their 2SV

h3. Expected Results
The admin should be able to exclude only that user from 2SV, just as it's the case with non-provisioned accounts

h3. Actual Results
The Atlassian organization shows that account as provisioned and the admin is asked to go to the identity provider for 2SV, when in fact it's the Atlassian 2SV that needs to be reset

h3. Workaround
The admin can only disable the enforcement of 2SV for everyone, to allow that particular user to reset it.

Authentication policies might help solve this issue, but currently this functionality is not rolled out to 100% of organizations.
fields.summary: Accounts synced from GSuite can't have their Atlassian 2SV reset

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Similar to but not the same as: ACCESS-819 - "Allow account deactivation for unverified accounts"
 * Since ACCESS-617 - "Unverified email addresses does not appear under Managed Accounts" was shipped, unverified Atlassian accounts are now surfaced to the Managed accounts page in the organization UI
 * There are buttons to delete or deactivate the unverified account within the UI, but when clicked, admins receive an error message(see below)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to an unverified Atlassian account in the organization UI
 # Try to delete or deactivate the account

h3. Expected Results
 * The account is deactivated or is marked for deletion(14 day grace period)

h3. Actual Results
 * 403 response:
{noformat}
{"errorKey":"forbidden","errorDetail":"Error: Principal cannot manage account of non-managed user"}
{noformat}
!Screenshot 2021-03-02 at 15.32.12.png!

h3. Workaround
 * Verify the account first, and then you'll be able deactivate or delete the account
fields.summary: Unable to deactivate or delete unverified accounts

fields.description:
At the moment, session duration is based on the idle time of the end users in Atlassian cloud. 

To comply with certain policies, session duration settings should also have an option for timeout when a user has been active for a certain amount of time (ie. log out after 10 hours)
fields.summary: Session duration : Additional timeout considering active hours

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Multi-byte characters are garbled in Audit log
 !image-2021-03-02-17-24-04-100.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
detailed steps is unidentified. One customer reports that it's reproduced in Microsoft Edge, but it's not reproduced in my environment.
 # Open Google chrome
 # Set browser language to Japanese
 # Set preferred language to Japanese 
 # Access to Audit log from admin.atlassian.com

h3. Expected Results
Audit logs are shown correctly

h3. Actual Results
Audit logs are garbled 

h3. Workaround
You can get the correct logs by exporting the logs
*   !image-2021-03-02-17-28-00-715.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Multi-byte characters are garbled in Audit log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [Organisation audit logs|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/track-organization-activities-from-the-audit-log/] are now bundled with our Premium subscriptions (Confluence and/or Jira). The logs help our customers to be aware on what's happening on their Instances in terms of user management, however, approving an access request doesn't generate a log on the Organisation for the user invitation/granting access to the product.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have a Confluence Premium subscription.
 # Access any page, using a non admin account.
 # Use the *Share* button to invite a user to your Instance.
 # Once the invitation is sent, access the Instance administration with an admin account.
 # Approve the access request.
 # Check the Org audit logs.

h3. Expected Results

There should be a record logging the admin adding the user to the Instance, and granting product access.
h3. Actual Results

Approving the access request doesn't generate any log on the Org audit logs.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Approving an access request doesn't generate a log on the Org audit logs

fields.description: Ability to configure SSO for users without verifying the domain.
fields.summary: Enforce SSO on external users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

An SSO-enabled user receives the below error when logging in if a user is not assigned to the Atlassian cloud application on IDP. 
{noformat}
Message: AADSTS50105: The signed in user 'user@example.com' is not assigned to a role 
for the application '33333333-2222-1111-aaaa-ebbbbbbbb'(Atlassian Cloud).{noformat}
The message is confusing, and the administrator does not get clarity on where to check for user assignment. It would be better to mention about Atlassian cloud application on IDP
{noformat}
Message: AADSTS50105: The signed in user 'user@example.com' is not assigned to a role 
for the application '33333333-2222-1111-aaaa-ebbbbbbbb'(Atlassian Cloud application on IDP).{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable SAML SSO for an organization
 # Do not assign a user to the Atlassian cloud application on Azure.
 # Login user via SSO

h3. Expected Results

The error message should be more clear and precise to the point administrator in the right direction.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Improve SSO enabled user login error messaging

fields.description:
Currently, when an external user. get deactivated or their access is removed from Atlassian Cloud App, user is removed from the Synced groups and any Product access given to the user based on the synced group gets removed as well.

However, the external user still exists on the Cloud Site with Site Access enabled.

Suggestion:

It would be nice to remove the user from the Site or disable the Site access of the user once he gets removed from the Provisioning group
fields.summary: Ability to disable Site Access when external users. get deactivated on IDP or are removed from the provisioned groups

fields.description:
The new version of Gsuite (Provided with a paid AA subscription) leverages SCIM APIs for syncing users and groups.

It would be nice to support REST API calls to create, update users and groups with Gsuite as is available with other Identity Providers.

https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/api-group-groups/#api-scim-directory-directoryid-groups-post
fields.summary: Support for Provisioning APIs for Gsuite

fields.description:
h3.  
{panel:title=Resolution update}
Hi,

Since users login to their Atlassian accounts rather than into a site, SSO can only be enforced at the Account level. 

Thanks,

Narmada Jayasankar

Product Manager, Atlassian Access
{panel}
h3. Suggestion

Currently, when we enable SAML SSO settings in our organization, it affects the way that the users will log in to their Atlassian Accounts as a whole. 
 For managed accounts, it would be good to have an option to choose which of the products would require SSO for the users to log in, for example, letting the users forced to use SSO on Confluence and JIRA, but not for Trello.
fields.summary: Ability to choose which products will require SSO

fields.description:
With the IP allowlisting feature, users can specify which IP addresses will be able to access Confluence and Jira Cloud instances.


*Suggestion*
It would be useful if the blocked request is recorded somewhere in the Admin Audit Log for the Admin to verify the source IP's.
fields.summary: Ability to search blocked source IP in the allow list tab
Improve error message for deleting configuration for SAML while in use by authentication policy

fields.description:
Currently, if we want to Unlink a Groups created is Atlassian via IDP (SCIM), we need to remove the SCIM/User Provisioning Configuration from the Organisation.

The following API, deletes the group from Atlassian instead on Unlinking it


{noformat}
curl --request DELETE \
  --url 'https://api.atlassian.com/scim/directory/dir/Groups/gid' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>'
{noformat}

*Suggestion:*
Requirement here is to Unlink some groups from SCIM (make these groups Mutable) without deleting the SCIM Configuration.
fields.summary: Allow SCIM Unlink of Groups synced from IDP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users with an [Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access] subscription are able to integrate their Org with an external Identity Provider using [User Provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] (SCIM integration).

We are currently releasing the ability to use this integration to also sync external users (users from unverified domains).

However, in case you are syncing external users, if you click on *Force Sync* on Okta (you can find this button under *Atlassian cloud Attribute Mappings*, accessing  the Atlassian app > *Provisioning*), the external accounts will get unlinked on the Atlassian directory side, being removed from the synced groups, even if no change was performed on these accounts.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a SCIM integration between Okta and Atlassian.
 # Sync a group with unmanaged accounts.
 # Access the Atlassian App on Okta.
 # Navigate to *Provisioning*.
 # Click on ***Force Sync*, without making any change on the attributes or their values.

h3. Expected Results

As no change was synced to the external accounts, they shouldn't be unlinked neither removed from the synced groups on Atlassian side. 
h3. Actual Results

The accounts are unlinked and removed from the synced groups. Below log is displayed on the *troubleshooting logs* for User Provisioning (on the Org):
{noformat}
Email update to unmanaged user with ID #, primary email <user-email>, unlinked any associated atlassian account.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Engage Atlassian Support team providing this bug report, so we can manually re-link the account on our side.
fields.summary: Performing a Force Sync on Okta will unlink unmanaged accounts on the Org

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When users need to use Webhooks, for example in automation, and the allow listing polices are enabled, the [Atlassian IP's|https://ip-ranges.atlassian.com/] are automatically blocked and in order to be accessible they need to be added in the allowlist which uses 32 out of the available 100 configurable IPs.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable allow listing policies
 # Attempt to use a webhook from an automation rule pointing to the originating instance.
 # Unless the Atlassian IPs are added in the allowlisting policies the webhok operation fails.

h3. Expected Results
Atlassian's own IPs should be allowed automatically even if the allowlisting policies are turned on. Also this shouldn't count toward the 100 limit provided to the customers
h3. Actual Results
Atlassian IPs need to be manually added and they count towards the 100 IP limit.

{code}
jira { "errorMessages": [ "The IP address has been rejected because it is not on the allowedlist. See your admin for more information." ], "errors": {} }
{code}
h3. Workaround
Customer needs to manually add Atlassian's IPs in the allowlist.
fields.summary: Enabling allow listing policies automatically blocks Atlassian's own IPs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Org admins are able to generate [admin API keys|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/create-an-admin-api-key-969537932.html], to be used on our [admin APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/rest-apis/]. All admin API keys have an expiration date, that can goes until a year. Although it is expected that the key will expire on the desired date, users aren't notified when that happened. That being said, in case an admin has an ongoing integration relying on the API key, and they forget about the expiration date, this would cause an impact to the integration flow, and it would take some time for the admin to find out the issue and generate a new API key to use.
h3. Suggested Solution

Notify the Org admins via email that the API key will expire soon. That will give them time to plan when to generate a new one and update it on the desired places without having an impact.
fields.summary: Notify Org admins when an admin API key is about to expire

fields.description:
Jumpcloud is an identity provider that can be integrated with Atlassian Access via SAML. Some customers have integrated this with Atlassian. It would be good to get this added to the list of supported IDP's in our docs:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html]

Here is the documentation to integrate JumpCloud with Atlassian:
 [https://support.jumpcloud.com/support/s/article/Identity-Management-with-Atlassian-Cloud]
fields.summary: Support JumpCloud as IDP for SAML single sign-on

fields.description:
By default, administrators are able to include up to 100 IP addresses to be whitelisted within the [IP allowlist feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/ip-allowlisting-998658750.html]. When this limit is exceeded by enabling a list, the following message is displayed:

{quote}
*Something went wrong*

We ran into a problem updating the allowlist. Try again in a few minutes.
{quote}

 !IP_limit.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Suggestion

As this message is triggered because the limit has been exceeded, this could be misleading as the users will try again, but, it will not work.

This is a suggestion to update the message to let the users know that the limit has been exceeded and it is necessary to remove IPs from a list in order to add new ones.
fields.summary: Update the message when the list of IPs in the allowlist exceeds the limit

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The documentation states that only 100 IP ranges can be added to the IP allow listing configurations. Sometimes, it may be needed to add more ranges without removing existing ones.
fields.summary: Allow more than 100 IP ranges to be configured in the IP allowlisting configuration

fields.description:
*Summary*

Currently, when user using SSO for authentication it is being handled by identity provider which means new users don't need to verify their account although when they don't have a mailbox.

Use case :
- Account in Azure AD has an UPN under the organization's claimed domain.
- UPN is used as the Name identifier for the SAML-SSO integration
- Account does not have an smtp mail address under the organization's claimed domain. 
- End user can create an Atlassian Account via SSO login but they will not able to receive application emails.
fields.summary: Verify an account before they can access a site.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, admins only have an option to terminate the managed accounts session which is Org > *Security* > *Password management* > *Reset password* button. This will end the session for all the *Managed accounts* in the org in all products. 

There is no option to revoke the session for specific users. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a more granular option where the admins can revoke the session within the users' profile at the org.
fields.summary: Atlassian Account session: provide a granular option to terminate the users' session

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the integration tries to update and synced account email address to a different one that is already tied to an Atlassian account, the process fails and displays an unspecific error in the screen as we can see below:

Only the support team has access to the logs that shows the cause for that error, therefore, the admins have no way to know how they can work around this situation without opening a ticket. 

*Note:* despite the error message the sync does not stop because of this difficulty. It will be triggered every 4 hours to add/remove/change other users but that update will still fail. 

h3. Workaround:
- *Org Admins: Solution for the error when you know what update was pushed*
# Access the target email account at the org (Org > Directory > Managed accounts > select the user)
# Change that account's email address to a different prefix i.e. prefix.old@yourdomain.com
# Trigger a manual sync at Org > Directory > G Suite that will allow the integration to update the account.
- *Org admins: solution for the error when you don't know what is the update being pushed*
# Open a support ticket. When you know the accounts involved in this issue, proceed with the changes mentioned above. 

h3. Suggested solutions:
Create a better error message that specifies to the org admins what changes are failing so they can proceed with the changes without the need of creating a support ticket.
fields.summary: Improve Org-level Gsync/G Suite error message handling

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently when you verify and claim a domain, all the accounts become managed under one organization only. 

This can be troublesome when a worldwide large company has multiple divisions connected only by the top domain for the email.

Should an organization, corresponding to a division, claims the domain, all the users would become managed under that organization only. This could lead to undesired results as the divisions may likely be divided legally, physically and economically.
fields.summary: Allow domain claims to manage a set of users

fields.description:
When [verifying a domain for an organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html], one of the parts will be to claim the accounts, which will provide the administrator with a number of accounts to be claimed and an option to export this information.

When organizations have Atlassian Access, if the claimed accounts have access to specific Atlassian products, this will add the users to the [Atlassian Access bill|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-your-bill-for-atlassian-access-948237309.html] and make sure about the billing, the closest workaround is to export these accounts and add the number of billable users in the [Atlassian Access pricing calculator|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access/pricing].

h3.Suggestion

For organizations that have Atlassian Access, this is a suggestion to also include the pricing/bill for the product during the claiming process based on the number of accounts that will be claimed.

This way, the administrators can already organize themselves with the company based on the pricing that will need to be paid for Atlassian Access.
fields.summary: Clarifications on pricing when claiming accounts

fields.description: Currently the maximum number of audit logs that can be stored is 10000. In the case of companies with a very large number of users, old events can disappear much earlier like 14 days. In order to store 180 days of data, the limit needs to be raised to somewhere around 200000 events. However, there is no feature provided to achieve this.
fields.summary: The ability to expand the maximum number of audit logs that can be stored.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Transferring products from one organization to another can lead to exceeding the license limit on the member sites. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Org-A with Site-A

- Setup Jira Free on Site-A
- Consume all 10 free licenses
- Make sure site-admin group is configured for Jira product access.

2. Org-B with Site-B

- Add a org admin account that is unique to Org-B

3. Transfer Org-B to Org-A

h3. Expected Results

Pre transfer or post transfer, there should be an action to fix the license limit being reached. 

h3. Actual Results

The unique admin from Org-B is transferred to Org-A and Jira license is granted. License limit is exceeded. 

 !limit.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Review the license use after a transfer and revoke licenses as needed.
fields.summary: Transfer organization can exceed the site product license limit

fields.description:
h4. Summary

We allow the domain (example: *mydomain.com*) and its complete FQDN (example: [*www.mydomain.com*)|http://www.mydomain.com%29/] to be verified. 
 For claiming accounts, we need to verify the domain (*mydomain.com*), not the complete FQDN. Few customers claimed FQDN *[(www.mydomain.com|http://www.mydomain.com%29/])* and were under the impression their domain verification for claiming accounts is done. 
 This confuses customers.
h4. Suggestion

Either add some validation or some messaging for the end-user while verifying domain informing them of difference between verifying domain (example: *mydomain.com*) and its complete FQDN (example: [*www.mydomain.com*)|http://www.mydomain.com%29/]
fields.summary: Clarity on domain verification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [User Management REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/api-group-users/] is not working on some Orgs. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate an admin API key following [these steps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/create-an-admin-api-key-969537932.html], on an Org you are an admin.
 # Try to call any of the endpoints listed in the [User Management REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/api-group-users/].

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to use the API as expected.
h3. Actual Results

The API returns below error:
{code:java}
{"key":"forbidden.insufficientScope","context":{"message":"Insufficient scope for this action","acceptableScopes":
["manage:org","manage:me:DUMMYSCOPE"]},
"errorKey":"forbidden.insufficient-scope","errorDetail":{"message":"Insufficient scope for this action","acceptableScopes"
["manage:org","manage:me:DUMMYSCOPE"]}} {code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: User Management REST API is not working on some Organizations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Directory > Managed accounts > Export accounts, the export doesn't show *Last active on...* for Bitbucket and Trello products.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to admin.atlassian.com, Directory > Managed accounts > Open an active account that has Bitbucket and Trello access.
# Check the *Last active* for Bitbucket, Trello products
# Now using the *Export accounts* option, export the managed accounts 
# The export file will not have columns added for *Last active on Bitbucket in bitbucket.org* and the *Last active on Trello in trello.com*

h3. Expected Results
The user export should have the *Last active* entries for Bitbucket, Trello 

h3. Actual Results
Last active entries for Bitbucket, Trello products are missing in the user export

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Note: Attached the user export for the month of October (where the Last active for Bitbucket and Trello was shown) and November (Last active entries missing)
fields.summary: Managed user export doesn't show last active for Bitbucket and Trello

fields.description:
Without this feature, when we access the customer's environment for the purpose of investigation, an audit log will be left and the customer may feel unsafe that there was a suspicious access.
I think it would be good if the logs accessed by Atlassian employees were marked in some way.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to identify members of atlassian support in audit logs

fields.description: In some specific cases (and when dealing with other SaaS products), Org Admins need to set allowlist restrictions based on domain. This is especially relevant when IP addresses and IP ranges aren't available to add to the allowlist.
fields.summary: Include the ability to add Domains/URLs to the Allowlist

fields.description:
When [verifying a domain for an organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html], one of the parts will be to claim the accounts, which will provide the administrator with a number of accounts to be claimed and an option to export this information.
