When organizations have Atlassian Access, if the claimed accounts have access to specific Atlassian products, this will add the users to the [Atlassian Access bill|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-your-bill-for-atlassian-access-948237309.html] and make sure about the billing, the closest workaround is to export these accounts and add the number of billable users in the [Atlassian Access pricing calculator|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access/pricing].

h3.Suggestion

For organizations that have Atlassian Access, this is a suggestion to also include the pricing/bill for the product during the claiming process based on the number of accounts that will be claimed.

This way, the administrators can already organize themselves with the company based on the pricing that will need to be paid for Atlassian Access.
fields.summary: Clarifications on pricing when claiming accounts
Allow syncing users to local Product Default Access Group over SCIM

fields.description:
With the [IP allowlisting feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/ip-allowlisting-998658750.html], users can specify which IP addresses will be able to access Confluence and Jira Cloud instances.

For companies that work with Cloud computer security platforms for data protection, it is needed to add the corresponding IP addresses from these platforms in order to not interrupt the user's usage from a whitelisted IP.

h3.Suggestion
For scenarios where a VPN is used and a security platform is implemented, making all traffic from the company being resolved to it, if the users connect outside of the VPN, they will still be able to access the instances because the IPs will be coming from the security platform.

This is a suggestion to conditionally whitelist the security platform IP addresses after confirming that the user is connecting through one of the whitelisted IPs from the IP allowlisting feature.
fields.summary: Conditionally whitelist IPs from security/external platforms

fields.description:
*Use Case:*

Users synced from external IDPs get product Access Automatically however no invitation is sent to these users informing them about the same.

*Suggestion:*

Ability for the Org Admins/ Site Admins to enable invitation emails for IDP synced users without manually inviting each user.
fields.summary: Ability to send invitation email for IDP synced users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As an org administrator, when a [domain is verified|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html], all the accounts belonging to it will become [managed by the organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managed-accounts-873871203.html], which will allow the administrators to [edit the profile details of these users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/make-changes-to-a-managed-user-account-964957894.html], like the email address.

During the recent changes, admins can no longer update an email of an account to a domain not managed by the organization. When attempting to change it, the following will be displayed:
{quote}You are unable to change the email address of a managed account to another domain that is not managed by your organization.
{quote}
(i) This information is also included in the [article to make changes to managed accounts|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/make-changes-to-a-managed-user-account/].
h3. Suggestion

For some organizations, this can be useful for scenarios like the following:
 * For educational institutions, when a member is no longer part of the institution, they could have their email changed to personal ones if they have access to personal content, like Trello boards or content created in the Atlassian products used by the organization.
 * When someone mistakenly create personal content in the work account, they could change the user's email address to a personal one and create a new dedicated account to allow the user to still have access to the content.

This is a suggestion to allow admins to change the email to domains not managed by the organization.
fields.summary: Allow managed account email addresses to be changed to a domain not verified at the organization

fields.description:
When an org admin verifies a domain in their organization, they should only be able to do so from their account that is in that particular domain.

This will reduce the confusion that end-users have when they receive the email about their account being managed by the administrator. 

Sometimes, if the administrator uses a personal email address, end-users might suspect a security breach, since they don't know who the admin is.
fields.summary: a domain should be verifiable only by users in that domain

fields.description:
*Summary*

For example, the user has two sites in his organization. 
He needs provision users and groups only to one site, there is no option to remove the site from the user provisioning.


*Workaround*

# Remove user provisioning configuration 
# Transfer products where you don't want to use User Provisioning to another organization https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/transfer-products-to-another-organization-967318518.html
# Set up User Provisioning again in your main organization
fields.summary: Ability to exclude a site from User Provisioning (SCIM)
